data.message: Why are Coca cola lobbying against plastic bottle schemes in UK. So much pollution is  caused by plastic rubbish.....

replies.message: Hi Annelise, our packaging is really valuable to us – it’s essential for our business and for people to be able to enjoy our drinks. We are focused on how we can use less and recover and recycle more. Read more about how our view on packaging, litter and recycling: http://spr.ly/61858RFoN

I don't think that addresses the issue at all.  You just don't want to do something that'll impact on your profits. Meanwhile the countryside is littered with rubbish and the oceans swimming in plastics. Face up to your responsibilites for once.
I think that's down too the people that litter not the business? Just dirty people out there who can't find a bin.
Not content with selling unhealthy products Coca Cola don't want to dent their profits by helping the environment.....

Paul. They can't control what their customers do with their products, that's down to the ppl and the council. But all it really takes is someone or a group of ppl to get off their ass and do something about.

People could always put their rubbish in bins! Recycling bins. Im pretty sure every county in the UK offer reycycling, but if the countryside is littered with plastic its not really a companies fault is a fault with society. I hate littering!!!!
